messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Sandra's article
messages.msgSnippet: Mary:  School really isn t fun.  Just step back, she will see the oppression of it in no time.  Lisa who has been there. ... From: maryfhickman@jps.net
messages.messageBody:
Mary: School really isn't fun. Just step back, she will see the
oppression of it in no time. Lisa who has been there.

-----Original Message-----
From: maryfhickman@... [mailto:maryfhickman@...]
Sent: Monday, July 15, 2002 9:16 AM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Sandra's article



Thank you, Sandra, for the link to your article about your sister's
family.
It's Mary here who has had a child now ask for school. She has been
home,
unschooled her almost 8 years. She's going in for an insiders veiw she
says.
And added, I'm going to school for fun, everyone else has to go.

This fall will be unique. Ashley will start 3rd grade at the end of
August. My
2 other little ones will be here home. I suspect our days will be spent
riding
Ashley to school, playing at home, the park, and visiting local places
like
the firestation, then picking Ashley up. It's like stepping back 2 years
when
my oldest was 5. Time will move slower for us at home and I look forward
to
that. Ashley keeps teasing me that I do not want her to go to school,
which I
answer back,"I want you to go to satisfy your need to go, I just don't
want
you to stay there very long". She has said now she thinks she will go to
school for at least 2-3 years. I'm hoping for a few months, yet again,
this is
her choice, she's making it and I'm, gulp, supporting it.

Mary

We all got fishing poles and are practicing our casts. Next year maybe
will
put hooks on them and try fishing for real.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Sandra's article
messages.msgSnippet: ... this is ... Rain has talked about going to school on and off. I think being at theater workshop by 9 every morning in Woodland may have ended that. She
messages.messageBody:
On Mon, 15 Jul 2002 08:15:56 -0700 <maryfhickman@...> writes:
>She has said now she thinks she will go to
> school for at least 2-3 years. I'm hoping for a few months, yet again,
this is
> her choice, she's making it and I'm, gulp, supporting it.

Rain has talked about going to school on and off. I think being at
theater workshop by 9 every morning in Woodland may have ended that. She
loves theater workshop, but even that's not worth waking up so early some
days. And school would mean waking up an hour earlier...

>
> We all got fishing poles and are practicing our casts. Next year maybe
will
> put hooks on them and try fishing for real.
>
Oh, do, we love it! You can go up to Colusa and fish for bluegill in some
of the backwater sections at the state park, just put a #10 baitholder
hook with a small nightcrawler at the bottom and a bobber a couple of
feet up, and you don't have to cast very far.... it's a great lazy summer
afternoon thing to do.

Dar

messages.subject: Sandra's article
messages.msgSnippet:
Thank you, Sandra, for the link to your article about your sister s family.
It s Mary here who has had a child now ask for school. She has been home,
messages.messageBody:
Thank you, Sandra, for the link to your article about your sister's family.
It's Mary here who has had a child now ask for school. She has been home,
unschooled her almost 8 years. She's going in for an insiders veiw she says.
And added, I'm going to school for fun, everyone else has to go.

This fall will be unique. Ashley will start 3rd grade at the end of August. My
2 other little ones will be here home. I suspect our days will be spent riding
Ashley to school, playing at home, the park, and visiting local places like
the firestation, then picking Ashley up. It's like stepping back 2 years when
my oldest was 5. Time will move slower for us at home and I look forward to
that. Ashley keeps teasing me that I do not want her to go to school, which I
answer back,"I want you to go to satisfy your need to go, I just don't want
you to stay there very long". She has said now she thinks she will go to
school for at least 2-3 years. I'm hoping for a few months, yet again, this is
her choice, she's making it and I'm, gulp, supporting it.

Mary

We all got fishing poles and are practicing our casts. Next year maybe will
put hooks on them and try fishing for real.
